Welcome to How To Cook That, I'm Ann Reardon
and today we are celebrating something to
do with 3.
3 of these ones ...
Yes that's right, 3 million subscribers!

That is so many, thank you, thank you, thank
you, thank you, thank you, 3 million times
to all of you who have subscribed.

Special thank you to those who have been around
for a long time, since the early days.
Loyal subscribers.

And thank you also to those of you who are
new and helped us tick over the 3 million,
welcome to the How To Cook That family.

We're sure that you'll love it here, everyone
is very kind and really nice in the comments
and very supportive of each other, so welcome.

Thank you to everyone who has watched the
videos and has subscribed.

Now to help celebrate 3 million subscribers,
because it's super exciting, we thought we'd
hide some prizes around the world for you.

So with the help of some friends of ours,
we have hidden 3 movie tickets in 3 different
libraries around the world.

So check out this next bit of the video so
you can find out where they are and be the
first to go and get them.

Now no video about 3 million subscribers would
be complete without talking about the changes

to the algorithm that has been a big topic
on YouTube at the moment.

The algorith basically says what's going to
be suggested on the side of videos which makes
a big difference as to what gets views.

So what used to get views seemed to be the
channels that you've subscribed to, that you
liked would be suggested on the side.

YouTube shifted it to be things that are new
and trending and viral rather than the stuff
that gets views over time.

So basically any channel that has evergreen
type content, so quality content that takes

time to produce, doesn't get viral views straight
away but builds over time ... those channels
have suffered in the algorithm change.

Which as you would expect would be a lot of
cooking channels, a lot of the gaming channels

have been affected, in fact most of the YouTubers
that you know and love would have been affected
by the algorithm change.

Make sure you actually click on your subscription
tab and go in there to turn on notifications,
so you get notified when they have a new video.

And check out their video each week, make
sure you watch it, make sure you comment,

like, make sure you share to let other people
know about it.

And if there's a video that you don't like,
that you think is just clickbait, don't comment
on it.

Don't click dislike, don't interact with it
in any way, just click straight off it.

Because if the algorithm sees you commenting,
it doesn't know you're saying I don't like

this, it just thinks you're passionate about
it.

You're interacting with it, so go back to
the people that you're subscribed to and comment
on their content.

Often it's a lot easier to be negative and
say we don't like this, rather than going

we do like this, so take a moment to actually
be positive.

Go to the channels you do like and comment
on their's instead.

And this is also the week sadly we have to
say goodbye.

We have filmed 250 odd videos in my very own
kitchen in Sydney where we lived.

Beautiful natural light, big benchtop, all
the videos that you've seen.

This was also the house that I brought Jedd
home in as a baby, rocked him to sleep when
he was really sick for those first 4 weeks.
Brought him back from hospital there.

But we're packing everything up into boxes
and driving all the way over across the countryside,
changing states over to Melbourne.

Sadly the kitchen where we are moving is actually
not suitable for filming.

So we had to make a BIG DECISION as to where
we would continue filming because we need

to put in quite a financial commitment to
obviously make somewhere suitable for filming,

get all the lights that we need because there's
no big natural light window facing the right

direction and everything like we had at our
old house.

But don't worry, we have decided to invest
the money for you guys and spend the money,
so that we can continue filming.

There might be a few weeks of transition as
get lights and different bits set up where

it might be a little bit unusual but we will
get there and it's going to be exciting and
an exciting journey.

People who want to be part of the actual,

Subscribe to HowToCookThat for more crazy,
